t: Luke 18
The Parable of the Persistent Widow
Now*p he told them a parable on the need for them to pray always and not give up.
“There*r was*r a*r judge*r in*r a*r certain*r town*r who*r didn’t*r fear*r God*r or*r respect*r people.*r
And*r a*r widow*r in*r that*r town*r kept*r coming*r to*r him,*r saying,*r ‘Give*r me*r justice*r against*r my*r adversary.’*r
“For*rp a*r while*r he*r was*r unwilling,*r but*r later*r he*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘Even*r though*r I*r don’t*r fear*r God*r or*r respect*r people,*r
yet*r because*r this*r widow*r keeps*r pestering*r me,*r I*r will*r give*r her*r justice,*r so*r that*r she*r doesn’t*r wear*r me*r out*r by*r her*r persistent*r coming.’”*r
Then*p the Lord said, “Listen*r to*r what*r the*r unjust*r judge*r says.*r
Will*r not*r God*r grant*r justice*r to*r his*r elect*r who*r cry*r out*r to*r him*r day*r and*r night?*r Will*r he*r delay*r helping*r them?*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r he*r will*r swiftly*r grant*r them*r justice.*r Nevertheless,*r when*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r comes,*r will*r he*r find*r faith*r on*r earth?”*r
The Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector
He*p also told this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous and looked down on everyone else:
“Two*r men*r went*r up*r to*r the*r temple*r to*r pray,*r one*r a*r Pharisee*r and*r the*r other*r a*r tax*r collector.*r

The*r Pharisee*r was*r standing*r and*r praying*r like*r this*r about*r himself:*r ‘God,*r I*r thank*r you*r that*r I’m*r not*r like*r other*r people — greedy,*r unrighteous,*r adulterers,*r or*r even*r like*r this*r tax*r collector.*r
I*r fast*r twice*r a*r week;*r I*r give*r a*r tenth*r of*r everything*r I*r get.’*r

“But*rp the*r tax*r collector,*r standing*r far*r off,*r would*r not*r even*r raise*r his*r eyes*r to*r heaven*r but*r kept*r striking*r his*r chest*r and*r saying,*r ‘God,*r have*r mercy*r on*r me,*r a*r sinner! ’*r

I*r tell*r you,*r this*r one*r went*r down*r to*r his*r house*r justified*r rather*r than*r the*r other,*r because*r everyone*r who*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.”*r
Blessing the Children
People*p were bringing infants to him so that he might touch them, but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
Jesus, however, invited them: “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r don’t*r stop*r them,*r because*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r belongs*r to*r such*r as*r these.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like*r a*r little*r child*r will*r never*r enter*r it.”*r
The Rich Young Ruler
A*p ruler asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
“Why*rp do*r you*r call*r me*r good?”*r Jesus asked him. “No*r one*r is*r good*r except*r God*r alone.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments:*r Do*ir not*ir commit*ir adultery;*ir do*ir not*ir murder;*ir do*ir not*ir steal;*ir do*ir not*ir bear*ir false*ir witness;*ir honor*ir your*ir father*ir and*ir mother.”*ir
“I*p have kept all these from my youth,” he said.

When*p Jesus heard this, he told him, “You*r still*r lack*r one*r thing:*r Sell*r all*r you*r have*r and*r distribute*r it*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven.*r Then*r come,*r follow*r me.”*r
After*p he heard this, he became extremely sad, because he was very rich.
Possessions and the Kingdom
Seeing*p that he became sad, Jesus said, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r have*r wealth*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
For*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r person*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Those*p who heard this asked, “Then who can be saved?”
He*p replied, “What*r is*r impossible*r with*r man*r is*r possible*r with*r God.”*r
Then*p Peter said, “Look, we have left what we had and followed you.”

So*p he said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r a*r house,*r wife*r or*r brothers*r or*r sisters,*r parents*r or*r children*r because*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r
who*r will*r not*r receive*r many*r times*r more*r at*r this*r time,*r and*r eternal*r life*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come.”*r
The Third Prediction of His Death

Then*p he took the Twelve aside and told them, “See,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem.*r Everything*r that*r is*r written*r through*r the*r prophets*r about*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r accomplished.*r
For*r he*r will*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r the*r Gentiles,*r and*r he*r will*r be*r mocked,*r insulted,*r spit*r on;*r
and*r after*r they*r flog*r him,*r they*r will*r kill*r him,*r and*r he*r will*r rise*r on*r the*r third*r day.”*r
They*p understood none of these things. The meaning of the saying was hidden from them, and they did not grasp what was said.
A Blind Man Receives His Sight
As*p he approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the road begging.
Hearing a crowd passing by, he inquired what was happening.
“Jesus of Nazareth is passing by,” they told him.
So*p he called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Then those in front told him to keep quiet, but he kept crying out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Jesus*p stopped and commanded that he be brought to him. When he came closer, he asked him,
“What*r do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r “Lord,”*p he said, “I want to see.”
“Receive*rp your*r sight,”*r Jesus told him. “Your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.”*r
Instantly he could see, and he began to follow him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God.
